articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Laila Bassam
articles.description: Coded messages. Landline phones. Pagers. Following the killing of senior commanders in targeted Israeli airstrikes, the Iran-backed Lebanese militant group, Hezbollah, has been using some low-tech strategies to try to evade its foe's sophisticated surveillance technology, informed sources told Reuters.
articles.title: How Hezbollah is trying to counter Israel's high-tech surveillance

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces killed at least 18 Palestinians on the second day of a stepped-up military offensive in the Gaza Strip on Tuesday that Islamist militant group Hamas said was jeopardizing ceasefire talks.
articles.title: Israeli forces step up military pressure on Gaza amid new ceasefire bid

articles.author: Olena Harmash, Max Hunder
articles.description: Donations poured in on Tuesday to help rebuild Kyiv's main children's hospital as Ukraine mourned at least 41 people killed during a major Russian missile assault on the Ukrainian capital and other cities a day earlier.
articles.title: Donations pour in as Ukraine mourns dozens killed in Russian air attack

articles.author: Tyler Clifford
articles.description: Hurricane Beryl made landfall near the coastal town of Matagorda in Texas early on Monday, pounding coastal areas with dangerous storm surges, strong winds and heavy rain as it moved inland, the U.S. National Hurricane Center (NHC) said.
articles.title: Hurricane Beryl expected to weaken quickly as it churns across Texas

articles.author: Mariela Nava
articles.description: Carolina Leal used to support socialist Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and, before that, his predecessor Hugo Chavez.
articles.title: In Venezuela, hunger stalks presidential election

articles.author: Estelle Shirbon, Tassilo Hummel
articles.description: French political leaders from the left-wing bloc that came first in Sunday's legislative election said they intended to govern according to their high-spending programme, but centrists said they should play a role as the left lacked a majority.
articles.title: French left says it can govern, but centrists say 'you need us'

articles.author: Yukiko Toyoda, John Geddie
articles.description: Russia's deepening military cooperation with North Korea has underlined the need for Japan to forge closer ties with NATO as regional security threats become increasingly intertwined, Prime Minister Fumio Kishida told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Japan must strengthen NATO ties to safeguard global peace, PM says

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden welcomes the heads of NATO member states to Washington on Tuesday for an annual summit that gives the embattled Democrat an international stage to convince allies at home and abroad he can still lead.
articles.title: Biden NATO summit a chance to show voters, allies he can still lead

articles.author: Vladimir Soldatkin
articles.description: Indian Prime Minister Narenda Modi told Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday that the death of innocent children was very painful, a day after a lethal strike on a children's hospital in Kyiv.
articles.title: Modi tells Putin that death of innocent children is very painful

articles.author: Saurabh Sharma, Shivam Patel
articles.description: Indian authorities have suspended six police and government officials after a stampede that killed 121 people last week, accusing them of "negligence" in handling the event featuring a Hindu preacher.
articles.title: India suspends six police, government officials for stampede that killed 121
